questions.question: What do you do if you find a damaged piece of equipment?

choices.answer: Report it to the teacher or supervisor

questions.question: Solutions that will be used in the hospital

choices.answer: Do not always need a label
Must be labeled and used as directed

questions.question: When handling any electrical equipment, be sure to

choices.answer: Wash your hands immediately before handling it
Check first for damaged cords or improper grounds
Plug equipment carefully into any socket to see if it sparks
Use it properly on the client and observe for malfunction

questions.question: Do not use an electrical appliance

choices.answer: If the ground prong is damaged

questions.question: Horseplay and practical jokes

choices.answer: Are permitted if no one is insulted
May be done during breaks or study time
Cause accidents and have no place in the clinical setting
Usually do not result in accidents

questions.question: The three things needed to start a fire are:
If your personal safety is in immediate danger

choices.answer: get the fire extinguisher and try to put the fire out
Run out of the area as fast as you can, yelling "FIRE!"
Evacuate the area quickly and efficiently

questions.question: Restraints

choices.answer: require a doctor's order before applying to a patient
should be applied tightly so the client can't escape
should be used to relieve the nursing staff

questions.question: Side rails

choices.answer: Should always be up on a patient's bed
Are restraints and should only be used when directed
Should never be used since patients tend to climb over them
Are a nuisance and new beds seldom have them

questions.question: The best way to contain a fire:

choices.answer: is to open the windows wide in the room

questions.question: Before leaving a patients room:

choices.answer: Call signal and supplies should be within patient's reach
Wheels on the bed should be locked
The area should be free of any hazards

questions.question: OSHA is a:

choices.answer: state organization supervising safety in the workplace
federal organization supervising safety in the workplace
hospital based organization supervising safety in workplace

questions.question: OSHA stands for
When pushing a patient on a stretcher down a ramp

choices.answer: The patient's head should be higher than their feet
Patient's head should be at the end closest to the nurse
the nurse should be at the patient's feet

questions.question: SDS
When going down a curb of a sidewalk with a patient in a wheelchair

choices.answer: Turn the wheelchair sideways and go down
wheel the chair off the curb with patient facing forward
keep walking until you find a ramp

questions.question: OSHA establishes and enforces safety standards for the workplace
Always make sure you have proper authorization before performing any procecure
If a patient is unconscious, it is not necessary to knock on the door before entering.
Spills of any kind should be wiped up immediately using proper procedure
When removing your gloves, you must wash your hands with soap and/or water/gel as soon as possible
If you want to know more about a substance you are working with, read the SDS form
It is okay to use an unlabeled bottle if you smell the contents first and identify the solution
The proper way to operate a fire extinguisher is to PASS (pull, aim, squeeze, sweep)
RACE stands for Run away from the fire, Activate the alarm, Close all doors, and Evacuate
It is important to dry hands fully when working with electrical appliances
